job_title: Chief Operations Officer-COO in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Valle is committed to the communities they serve. As the current COO, I am proud to work for an organization that strives to improve the lives, physical health, and mental health of those we serve. Our employees are dedicated individuals who commit to our mission.
cons: I don't have any cons at this time.

job_title: High Needs Case Manager in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Offer remote work and flexibility
cons: No chances for Pay raises. Constant change in policies. High turn over rate high case loaded and Incompetent supervisors with no support to staff

pros: -PTO -Flexibility -Weekends off -Pay is decent -Great place to learn and grow
cons: -lots of miscommunication -can be stressful if you don't have good time management skills -lots of changes regarding work -sometimes dirty break rooms -lots of outdated information/resources

pros:
VDS does a great job of hiring and recruiting solid leadership who are not only great clinicians, but strong leaders. 

I truly feel that my leader cares for me and my success. 

I have a strong work-life balance and am able to honor my role as a foster parent because of the flexibility that my job affords me. 

I also have noticed that VDS does a good job of rewarding high performers. 

VDS also listens to feedback from staff and takes that feedback seriously when making operational decisions. 

Finally, I feel empowered to do my work and connect with staff at various levels.
cons: Health insurance can be challenging at times.

review_title: Was great until mismanagement of budget
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
1) Immediate supervisors were helpful, caring, and had good availability
2) Great mission and values
3) Salary comparable to other non-profit agencies
cons:
1) Upper management is bad with budgeting leading to several lay offs, unrealistic productivity goals, and low morale
2) Very poor communication between upper and lower management, and between departments
3) Required adult counselors to change job description and only work with youth or be terminated by reduction of force
4) Employees involved in direct client care had no ability to offer ideas or feedback

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Lunas, NM
pros: The services provided are critically needed in the community. I have met some amazing people and learned to recognize my blessings.
cons: Negative work environment and retaliatory staff. Inadequate supplies and availability to necessary means to accomplish assigned task.

job_title: Director of Human Resources in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Valle del Sol values professional development and growth from within.  It has a culturally diverse workforce and offers  flexible work schedules.  I love the small company feel even as we have grown in size over the years.  The employees make Valle a great place to work.
cons: It can be challenging to keep up with frequent changes in funding.

job_title: GMH SA Coubselor II in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Supportive coworkers, good benefits, training funds, and incentives. Adult services department seemed to be more supportive than youth and family.
cons: Management seems to hire whomever when the need arises and doesn't take into consideration the position and well-established culture that exists. Layoffs, budget cuts, no raises or yearly bonuses

review_title: it was very interesting, different and full of knowledge.

cons: i was thrown on the job with out any training in my specific task

pros: Culture is amazing depending on location/supervisor. Ability to grow and thrive depending on colleagues you're surrounded by.
